DOC.brief_title: Preventing Recurrent Ulcer Bleeding Arthritis Patients Using Esomeprazole Plus Celecoxib
DOC.detailed_description: Among patient previous ulcer bleeding , neither nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug ( NSAIDs ) plus proton pump inhibitor ( PPI ) cyclooxygenase ( COX ) -2 inhibitor adequately prevent recurrent ulcer bleeding . The aim investigate whether add PPI COX-2 inhibitor superior COX-2 inhibitor alone prevention recurrent ulcer bleed high-risk patient . Patients arthritis present NSAID-induced ulcer bleed eligible healed ulcer follow-up endoscopy ; H. pylorus negative eradicate ; require regular NSAIDs . After ulcer heal , patient receive celecoxib 200 mg b.i.d . They randomly assign esomeprazole 20 mg b.i.d . placebo 12 month . The primary endpoint recurrent ulcer bleed . Results Intention-to-treat analysis include 273 patient ( 137 receive esomeprazole 136 receive placebo ) . Recurrent ulcer bleeding occur none receiving esomeprazole 8 patient receive placebo . The 12-month cumulative incidence recurrent bleed 0 % esomeprazole group 8.9 % placebo group ( difference , 8.9 percentage point ; 95 % confidence interval difference , 4.1 13.7 ; P=0.0004 ) . During follow-up , 16.1 % patient esomeprazole group 15.4 % placebo group use low-dose aspirin . Among patient use aspirin , cumulative incidence recurrent ulcer bleed 0 % esomeprazole group 7.1 % placebo group ( difference , 7.1 percentage point ; 95 % confidence interval , 2.4 11.8 ; P=0.004 ) . Conclusion Among patient arthritis previous NSAID-induced ulcer bleeding , add PPI COX-2 inhibitor superior COX-2 inhibitor alone prevention recurrent ulcer bleeding .
